extracted_playbook.title: Identify Evidence of Compromise
extracted_playbook.description: Check for signs of compromise such as loss of login access, requests to specific endpoints, unknown plugins, encrypted files, unexpected group members, and newly created user accounts.

extracted_playbook.title: Assume Compromise and Initiate Incident Response
extracted_playbook.description: If any evidence of compromise is found, assume the instance has been compromised and initiate the incident response process.

extracted_playbook.title: Update to a Fixed Version
extracted_playbook.description: Update Confluence Data Center and Server to a fixed version as recommended by CERT-EU.

extracted_playbook.condition: Can the instance be removed from the internet?

extracted_playbook.title: Remove Instance from the Internet
extracted_playbook.description: Remove the Confluence instance from the internet until the patch is deployed.

extracted_playbook.title: Restrict External Network Access
extracted_playbook.description: Restrict instances accessible to the public internet, including those with user authentication, from external network access.

extracted_playbook.title: Back Up Confluence Instances
extracted_playbook.description: Back up Confluence Data Center and Server instances if not done already.

extracted_playbook.title: Block Access to Known Attack Vectors
extracted_playbook.description: Block access to known attack vectors by modifying the web.xml file and restarting the vulnerable instances.
